appProperties.description: App-specific custom key-value pairs that the app developer can create for their specific site and use in the PMD. Key-value pairs within the map can be referenced in this manner: ${site.appProperties[key]}.

key.description: The name by which the property may be reference.

value.description: The value to return for the property.

flowDefinitions.description: List of flows that are used by the site, see 'flow' for the information each flow contains.

id.description: The id used to denote this flow. It can be used in a route to navigate to a flow.

name.description: The name for the flow. This is used to link a task orchestration tag to a flow.

flowSteps.description: The steps that make up the flow.

id.description: The id of the flow step. This id is used by the flow itself to denote the initial step or within flow step definitions to denote which step should follow after a user clicks next.

value.description: This property denotes the id of the task or flow step that will come next after the user successfully submits on the current flow step.

condition.description: This binding determines whether or not a transition to the step defined for the value property will be executed.

configurableModel.description: Defines the configurations on this flowStep in terms of which properties will allow logic to be used. See 'configurables' for more information.

attributes.description: List of the names of attributes on the corresponding tag that customers can set the value for.

allowLogic.description: When set to true, customers will be able to use binding values (when appropriate) on attributes they have control over.

allowMove.description: When set to true for the body tag of a page, customers will be able to move widgets within the context of the page.

disableAdd.description: When set to true for the body tag of a page, the ability to add widgets will be disabled for the customer within the context of the page.

cancelOutOfFlow.description: If set, will override it's parent 'cancelOutOfFlow' attribute behavior for this particular step.

taskId.description: The task id associated with this flow step.

skipStep.description: A binding that helps determine whether or not this step in the flow should be skipped.

taskBindingName.description: A binding to the task name associated with this flow step. This name will be displayed as the title of the step in a Task Orchestration.

name.description: The name of the flow step.

initialStepId.description: This field is used to determine the first step of the flow. This id should correspond to an id of one of the flow steps in this flow. If this property is omitted, then the initial step will be resolved to the first flow step defined for this flow.

endPoints.description: A list of endpoints to be used to retrieve data.

name.description:
A String used for referencing this endpoint in the page builder.
Access data in the response from this endpoint with the syntax 'name.labelOfDataToBePulled'.

url.description: A binding for the URL address of this endpoint: where the data will come from or be sent to.

isCollection.description:
When set to true, requests look at the size of the incoming data and retrieves the entirety of it through multiple requests.
For use with endpoints potentially retrieving large sets of data (>100 entries).

cacheable.description:
When set to true, data retrieved from this endpoint will be cached for future requests.
NOTE: Only set to true if data from this endpoint won't be updated frequently. Data from this endpoint may get stale since there is currently no way to cache invalidate.

external.description: When set to true, authorization schemes and accept-language are not set in the header of the request to the endpoint. Used for requests outside of Workday.

deferred.description:
When set to true, this endpoint will not be called at the time of rendering the page.
Primarily used with the 'Fetch Data' widget for retrieving data based on selections made by the user on the page.

exclude.description:
When set to true, no attempts to call this endpoint will be made.
Set to true when the URL for this endpoint could be invalid (Example: 'url': '${someData}' and 'someData' may be empty).

authType.description:
The 'AuthType' you are using to authenticate requests to this endpoint.
For example, if SSO or USERAUTH, you are authenticating the request as the logged in user.
Most other 'AuthTypes' are system level authentication.
Different 'AuthType's can be used on different endpoints on the same page.

useUserAuthWhenAvailable.description: When true, requests to this endpoint will use the userSession's 'AuthType' (if it is available) rather than the default (if a use 'AuthType' is available).

preprocessed.description:
Do not set to 'true' unless you discuss your use case with a VPS developer.
When true, data retrieved will not be treated as JSON.

baseUrlType.description:
WARNING: MAY BE DEPRECATED IN THE FUTURE.
A String that designates the application this endpoint is being used for, and thereby the structure of the complete URL for this endpoint.

bestEffort.description: When true, no error will be thrown when one normally would be. Instead, a JSON message will be received with an error message as a field.

ignoreFailures.description: Takes a list of failures types to ignore. For all error codes associated with the failure type no error will be thrown when one normally would. Instead, a JSON message will be received with an error message as a field.  Supported values (with associated status code in [] which is not part of the request) are  ALL, AUTH_RELATED_ERRORS [401, 403, 407], BAD_REQUEST [400], UNAUTHORIZED [401], FORBIDDEN [403], NOT_FOUND [404], NOT_ACCEPTABLE [406], REQUEST_TIMEOUT [408], UNSUPPORTED_MEDIA_TYPE [415], INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR [500], NOT_IMPLEMENTED [501], BAD_GATEWAY [502], SERVICE_UNAVAILABLE [503] and GATEWAY_TIMEOUT [504]

search.description:
Should be set to 'true' on an endpoint used for 'Faceted Search'.
When 'true', the endpoint will attach query parameters to the URL necessary for 'Faceted Search' to function.

service.description: An ID that maps this endpoint to a REST service.

path.description: The path to a resource under a Workday service. This is used to create the fully qualified url for Workday services in conjunction with the service identifier property.

headers.description: HTTP headers that are added to requests to this endpoint.'

id.description: A Workday ID that maps to an endpoint object in XpressO

httpMethod.description: A HTTP method for the Outbound Endpoint. It can have enumeration values as {GET, POST, PUT, DELETE}

values.description: List of Value objects used for defining rest call parameters

outboundPath.description: Attribute for variable name. Based on the scope of the variable, it can be set as flow variable or session variable for subsequent use.

value.description: Attribute for variable value whose name is specified in outboundPath attribute. It is binding object, so you can specify binding here.

exclude.description: Attribute for exclude condition. If this attribute evaluates true, the variable will be set, otherwise it will be ignored.

allowEmptyValue.description: This flag is to determine if an endpoint allows empty value as JSON outuput.

nested.description: When set the data from nested endpoints will be bound to current endpoint name

on.description: The list of endpoint information data

as.description: The reference to the current iterated object provided by the on attribute's input list

graphQuery.description: The query sent to GraphQL service

outboundEndPoints.description: A list of outbound endpoints to propagate data throughout the scope of the flow. Note that only flow scoped variables are supported.

variableScope.description: Attribute used to define the variable scope. Its value comes from enumeration set {session, flow}. Session value means the scoped variable can be referenced in pmd within user session, while flow value means the scoped variable can only be referenced in pmd within the flow definition.

values.description: This is the place you can define a list of parameter objects used for this outgoing Endpoint

name.description: Name is used as the reference for this outgoing Endpoint during binding.

httpMethod.description: Clear variables instead of setting them when the value is 'DELETE'. This attribute provides a way to clear unneeded variables.

boundAs.description: This attribute allows to bind one pmd tag to more than one Outbound Endpoint. See child tag outboundDataURI 'secondaryFor' attribute for detail.

flowParameters.description: A parameter that could be moved out to its own metadata in the future; the flowParameters allow the flow creator to specify the the filters underlying the flow for configuration.

id.description: A binding that uniquely identifies the instance - instance's identifier

descriptor.description: A binding that that describes the instances. Used as instance's display value

wid.description: A binding that uniquely identifies the workday identifier for related actions retrieval. Valid only on View pages

action.description: Action describes how the client should treat the instance when displayed as a link/button. Examples are Home, Attachment, PRIMARY. Actions strings are case sensitive.

target.description: Url for the instance - To be replaced with taskTag soon

iconId.description: Id for icons that are built in to UIC for display with instance. This has to be a meaningful icon available for client. For example, pdf icon can be 'mime_pdf'.

view.description: Determines whether or not the user has access to view the instance's details.  If true, the instance's text becomes a link.  If false, it remains plain text.

relatedTask.description: Binding to determine if related task icon is to be displayed. Note VPS does not support related tasks. This attribute is meant for sites that support SSO where related task requests can be answered by UI Server

preview.description: Binding to determine if the user has access to view a preview of the instance's details without needing to navigate to the instance. Note VPS does not support preview, this attribute is meant for sites that support SSO where a preview request can be answered by UI Server

mimeType.description: mimetype that is built in for UIC to view the instance inline or for a particular application to open it. For example, pdf mimetype can be 'application/pdf'.

exitUri.description: If set, flow will redirect to this URI after submit

toggleEndPoint.description: The endpoint used to retrieve application toggles.

flowBlob.description: An attribute that represents the flow model encoded as a string.

cancelOutOfFlow.description: If true, cancel button triggers will take a user out of the flow instead of going to the previous step.

exitTask.description: If set, flow will redirect to this task after submit

pods.description: List of pods used by the site in the PMD. See 'pod'.

podId.description: The unique ID of the pod that is referenced by Pod tags to insert the pod into a specific place within the presentation.

rawSeed.description: Same as @seed but the JSON is encoded into a string and will be deserialized upon reading the PMD.

seed.description: The contents of the pod. This should contain a hierarchy of tags that can be constructed in place of the pod tag.

endPoints.description: A list of endpoints to be used to retrieve data.

toggleEndPoint.description: The endpoint used to retrieve application toggles.

parameters.description: A list of parameter keys that defines what parameters are needed to populate values within the @template.

template.description: A generic container that should be filled with a tag that will be processed in place of the pod tag.

label.description: Label is the text that is present either to the side or above for most widgets. If a widget is a non-simple widget this property is not guaranteed to be respected. Basic widgets include inputs such as Text and Date. A widget such as the top-layer Grid however will not display a label.

automationId.description: AutomationId is solely used for automating the UI elements. The automationId present on the DOM will be a transformation from this automationId. If this value is not present, id will instead be used to generate the automationId

customId.description: CustomId is an attribute used only by Mobile Benefits to execute application-specific logic.

render.description: Render determines whether or not this tag will be turned into a widget. If this property is empty the widget will always be rendered. If true, then the widget will also be rendered. If false this tag, and all children tags, will not be rendered. This is different from @visible in that references to this tag/widget will not be stored in the case that this is false.

configurableModel.description: Defines the configurations on this pmdTag in terms of which properties will allow logic to be used. See 'configurables' for more information.

sortOrder.description:
If 'sorted: true' on the 'section'/'fieldSet' parent of this widget, then this widget will be ordered within its parent according to this attribute, relative to its siblings.
Order is determined using Java String's 'compareTo' function.
Typically use values like 'a', 'b', 'c', etc. where the widget with 'sortOrder: a' will coome before the widget with 'sortOrder: b', and the widget with 'sortOrder: b' will come before the widget with 'sortOrder: c' and so on.

tasks.description: The tasks list defines the URLs that will be available to users of a site and declares which pages should be invoked when the URL patterns defined in those tasks are matched.

id.description: Used in 'taskReference' and other places in PMD to refer and link to this task.

page.description: Page that this task references, see 'page'

id.description: A unique identifier for this page.

flowValue.description: The ID of the flow that this task references.

authenticated.description: When true, will redirect the user to sign-in page if they attempt to reach this page without being signed-in.

authenticateRequiredAccountOnly.description: When true, will redirect the user to sign-in page if they attempt to reach this page without being signed-in, but ONLY if accounts are required for the site (if 'site's 'userAccountsRequired' is true)

accountHome.description: When true, this task will be what the user is routed to when they click on the user home page button. Should only be one task marked as true for the site.

extTasks.description: Tasks that exist in another site that need to be referenced by this site.

systemUserName.description: Set as the subject in IDTokens attached to requests made by VPS

loginProtocolModel.description: The login protocol that this application uses

protocol.description: The protocol that the model defines

accountCenter.description: Defines the tasks accessible through the Account Center page.

items.description: A list of tree view item tags to be displayed in the Account Center

label.description: Text that will represent the name of the tree item.

automationId.description: AutomationId is solely used for automating the UI elements. The automationId present on the DOM will be a transformation from this automationId. If this value is not present, id will instead be used to generate the automationId

customId.description: CustomId is an attribute used only by Mobile Benefits to execute application-specific logic.

render.description: Render determines whether or not this tag will be turned into a widget. If this property is empty the widget will always be rendered. If true, then the widget will also be rendered. If false this tag, and all children tags, will not be rendered. This is different from @visible in that references to this tag/widget will not be stored in the case that this is false.

configurableModel.description: Defines the configurations on this pmdTag in terms of which properties will allow logic to be used. See 'configurables' for more information.

sortOrder.description:
If 'sorted: true' on the 'section'/'fieldSet' parent of this widget, then this widget will be ordered within its parent according to this attribute, relative to its siblings.
Order is determined using Java String's 'compareTo' function.
Typically use values like 'a', 'b', 'c', etc. where the widget with 'sortOrder: a' will coome before the widget with 'sortOrder: b', and the widget with 'sortOrder: b' will come before the widget with 'sortOrder: c' and so on.

required.description: When true, the user will get an error when he submits the page if he/she didn't enter a value for this widget

visible.description:
When false, the widget will not appear on the page, but it will still exist in a hidden state.
Use this instead of render if the widget can be toggled to a viewable state.

enabled.description:
When true, the user will be able to enter a value for the widget.
When false, the user will only be able to view the widget and not interact with it.

helpText.description: Text that will appear when the user hovers their cursor over this widget.

label.description: Label is the text that is present either to the side or above for most widgets. If a widget is a non-simple widget this property is not guaranteed to be respected. Basic widgets include inputs such as Text and Date. A widget such as the top-layer Grid however will not display a label.

automationId.description: AutomationId is solely used for automating the UI elements. The automationId present on the DOM will be a transformation from this automationId. If this value is not present, id will instead be used to generate the automationId

customId.description: CustomId is an attribute used only by Mobile Benefits to execute application-specific logic.

render.description: Render determines whether or not this tag will be turned into a widget. If this property is empty the widget will always be rendered. If true, then the widget will also be rendered. If false this tag, and all children tags, will not be rendered. This is different from @visible in that references to this tag/widget will not be stored in the case that this is false.

configurableModel.description: Defines the configurations on this pmdTag in terms of which properties will allow logic to be used. See 'configurables' for more information.

sortOrder.description:
If 'sorted: true' on the 'section'/'fieldSet' parent of this widget, then this widget will be ordered within its parent according to this attribute, relative to its siblings.
Order is determined using Java String's 'compareTo' function.
Typically use values like 'a', 'b', 'c', etc. where the widget with 'sortOrder: a' will coome before the widget with 'sortOrder: b', and the widget with 'sortOrder: b' will come before the widget with 'sortOrder: c' and so on.

linkText.description: Text for the link that may provide more information about this guide.

linkUrl.description: Url for the link that may provide more information about this guide.

icon.description: Icon that will be displayed next to the header label for tree items in the tree view display.

subtitle.description: Text that will be displayed under the header label for tree items in the tree view display.

detailsUri.description: URL used to load and display the details content panel. Example format: /{tenant}/inst/{instance-id}/rel-task/{task-id}.{extension}

taskReference.description: Task details used to generate the URL for the details content panel if detailsUri is missing.

taskId.description: The wid of the task in XpressO. As this is a binding, multiple tasks may be referenced depending on the data but it is recommended to keep this field as simple as possible.

parameters.description: Allows for an object to be passed into the taskTag as parameters. "${json:create(json:attribute('testing', '1'))}" for example will tell the taskTag that 'testing' has a value of '1' for routing purposes.

childrenIids.description: Nodes keep track of their children nodes by their instance id's.

navigationLinks.description: Clickable tasks the user can select from in their navigation menu. This is only used on external sites.

render.description: A boolean binding that indicates whether or not to render the header link. The link will render when this is null or set to true, and will not render when this is set to false.

taskReference.description: The task that should be executed when clicked.

label.description: A string binding that will be displayed as the link's label.

dataProviders.description: List of base URLs used by endpoints in the PMDs of the site.

toggleEndPoint.description: The endpoint used to retrieve application toggles.

universalFooterPodId.description: The id of the pod containing the universal footer. This footer will be placed on every page in the site. If a footer is defined directly on a page, it will take precedence over the universal footer.
